data: {"page":1,"results":[{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":"/uXuxoktT74hcMqNvbf6dPKPCPHD.jpg","genre_ids":[99],"id":677,"original_language":"de","original_title":"Olympia - Fest der Völker","overview":"Commissioned to make a propaganda film about the 1936 Olympic Games in Germany, director Leni Riefenstahl created a celebration of the human form. This first half of her two-part film opens with a renowned introduction that compares modern Olympians to classical Greek heroes, then goes on to provide thrilling in-the-moment coverage of some of the games' most celebrated moments, including African-American athlete Jesse Owens winning a then-unprecedented four gold medals.","popularity":12.09,"poster_path":"/49KaePhxdoM3TkJHo8zaoCFEJ6X.jpg","release_date":"1938-04-20","title":"Olympia: Part One – Festival of the Nations","video":false,"vote_average":6.9,"vote_count":100},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":"/hbL5vWtqJrPCrLEcgQLT5lj2a8G.jpg","genre_ids":[99],"id":685,"original_language":"de","original_title":"Olympia - Fest der Schönheit","overview":"Commissioned to make a propaganda film about the 1936 Olympic Games in Germany, director Leni Riefenstahl created a celebration of the human form. Where the two-part epic's first half, Festival of the Nations, focused on the international aspects of the 1936 Olympic Games held in Berlin, part two, The Festival of Beauty, concentrates on individual athletes such as equestrians, gymnasts, and swimmers, climaxing with American Glenn Morris' performance in the decathalon and the games' majestic closing ceremonies.","popularity":8.272,"poster_path":"/oleIfZJ4NZebY9ETjoaZoTXYDLb.jpg","release_date":"1938-04-20","title":"Olympia: Part Two – Festival of Beauty","video":false,"vote_average":6.7,"vote_count":66},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99,10770],"id":858364,"original_language":"en","original_title":"Isamu Noguchi: Stones and Paper","overview":"Isamu Noguchi was a sculptor, designer, architect, and craftsman. Throughout his life he struggled to see, alter, and recreate his natural surroundings. His gardens and fountains were transformations meant to bring out the beauty their locations had always possessed.","popularity":1.772,"poster_path":"/7BudJqIfiu3lrLeL0AaE1QsFAET.jpg","release_date":"1997-06-25","title":"Isamu Noguchi: Stones and Paper","video":false,"vote_average":0.0,"vote_count":0},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99,10402],"id":858377,"original_language":"en","original_title":"Loretta Lynn: My Story In My Words","overview":"2021 marks the 50th anniversary of \"Coal Miner’s Daughter,\" the Loretta Lynn song that became a book, a feature film, and an indelible part of popular culture. Like so many other songs written by Lynn, the lyrics told the story of her life and spoke to women who struggled to make ends meet. Lynn’s simple, straightforward song stories gave legitimacy to the joys, heartaches, struggles and triumphs.","popularity":1.016,"poster_path":"/20W0L8jGRzlaCkFTVUU2SANUzrP.jpg","release_date":"2021-02-27","title":"Loretta Lynn: My Story In My Words","video":false,"vote_average":0.0,"vote_count":0},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99],"id":225980,"original_language":"en","original_title":"Die Geschichte der Auma Obama","overview":"The Education of Auma Obama is a captivating and intimate portrait of the U.S. president's older half-sister, who embodies a post-colonial, feminist identity.","popularity":2.557,"poster_path":null,"release_date":"2011-09-09","title":"The Education of Auma Obama","video":false,"vote_average":0.0,"vote_count":0},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":"/wLyd6pMRns545WaSmCq6cOZ5NQy.jpg","genre_ids":[99,36],"id":697685,"original_language":"it","original_title":"Non ci è stato regalato niente","overview":"Annita Malavasi was just 22 when the Germans occupied Italy, their former allies, in 1943. As a partisan in the Italian resistance named “Laila”, she moved throughout the Apennines with and between fighting units, delivering information, transporting weapons, and taking part in battles. She spent over a year in the Apennines, fighting against the German occupation. At the same time, she had to assert herself against the men of the mountain villages. By the end of the war, Laila had risen among the ranks to become one of the few female commanders in the Italian resistance.  This film chronicles the story of a lifelong struggle for emancipation that began with the battle for Italy’s liberation from fascism. Laila and her two comrades, Gina “Sonia” Moncigoli and Pierina “Iva” Bonilauri talk about their time in the Resistenza and what it meant to them and many other women.","popularity":5.564,"poster_path":"/AmN62FOqxWfiYWWiwc0zvmjqQsU.jpg","release_date":"2014-01-20","title":"We Weren't Given Anything for Free","video":false,"vote_average":7.0,"vote_count":1},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":"/6WgplZuAcRhbH5BYfvtP6L2QyWj.jpg","genre_ids":[99,16],"id":1022638,"original_language":"ca","original_title":"Diari d'un operador cinematogràfic","overview":"This is the story of my grandfather, Tiago Florit, who for 50 years was a film operator at the Teatre Principal de Maó, in Menorca. 7Countries7Days7Shows","video":false,"vote_average":4.8,"vote_count":22},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99],"id":388696,"original_language":"en","original_title":"Bihttoš","overview":"Bihttoš is an unconventional documentary that explores the complex relationship between a father and daughter. Through animation, re-enactments, and archival photos, writer/director Elle-Máijá Tailfeathers delves into the dissolution of her parents’ mythic love story and how it has colored her perception of love in her adult life.","popularity":0.737,"poster_path":"/iyB0tq73ZOJp6nOQKqGuSzXiWEQ.jpg","release_date":"2014-10-26","title":"Bihttoš","video":false,"vote_average":8.0,"vote_count":1},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99],"id":388723,"original_language":"fi","original_title":"Eleganssi","overview":"Elegance is a short film about a group of Finnish men, and the style and elegance of hunting partridge and pheasant. The film’s protagonists are all wealthy men, for whom hunting is a treasured hobby, a passion and a way of life. The film unfolds in three acts on a scenic autumnal field. Meet the three businessmen: Nokia’s former CEO, Jorma Ollila, engineering company Kone Oy’s owner, Antti Herlin, and the charming narrator, Publishing Company Otava’s former CEO, Heikki A. Reenpää. His narration leads the viewer through hunting expeditions, creates the mood and introduces the people. Almost equally important are the gentlemens’ dogs: handsome pointers and setters, whose pedigrees, abilities and hunting prowess ultimately determine whether any birds are caught at all.","popularity":1.788,"poster_path":"/8s1Y3Rm6y9HwZBPsvJx1fHamivt.jpg","release_date":"2016-01-27","title":"Eleganssi","video":false,"vote_average":6.5,"vote_count":2},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":"/g8qgNdvMLtnfWKjic1uCw93sT5Z.jpg","genre_ids":[99],"id":388725,"original_language":"en","original_title":"9 Days: From My Window in Aleppo","overview":"One morning in August 2012, renowned Syrian photographer Issa Touma saw young men lugging sandbags into his street. It turned out to be the start of the Syrian uprising in the city of Aleppo. Touma grabbed his camera and spent nine days holed up in his apartment, recording what was happening outside. The result? An unprecedented glimpse into a war that has been raging for three years now.","popularity":1.722,"poster_path":"/encOf2hGBp8tuSvRf5ccWDC9fyA.jpg","release_date":"2016-01-28","title":"9 Days: From My Window in Aleppo","video":false,"vote_average":8.0,"vote_count":1},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99],"id":388729,"original_language":"en","original_title":"A Tribute to Malcolm X","overview":"A short film made for William Greaves' \"Black Journal\" that discusses the influence of Malcolm X, and includes an interview with his widow, Betty Shabbazz.","popularity":1.509,"poster_path":"/b7ZlrQ6F0NJTu6OLKI8dtDHjpE9.jpg","release_date":"1967-01-01","title":"A Tribute to Malcolm X","video":false,"vote_average":8.7,"vote_count":3},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99],"id":226555,"original_language":"en","original_title":"View from the Acropolis","overview":"Griffith once noticed: \"What the modern movie lacks is the beauty of moving wind in the trees.\" As third part of the series of filmworks Monument to Another Man’s Fatherland, View from the Acropolis explores the site where the Pergamon Altar was taken from in the late 19th century. Today a Berlin highlight, the altar was originally built around 200 BC in Anatolia (present day Turkey). In the landscape, different cultures, present and past are interwoven, connected by their presence, the wind and the changing light.","popularity":0.407,"poster_path":null,"release_date":"2012-04-27","title":"View from the Acropolis","video":false,"vote_average":0.0,"vote_count":0},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99],"id":389050,"original_language":"en","original_title":"Weapon of War: Confessions of rape in Congo","overview":"Wherever war breaks out, men with guns rape. During the decades of conflict in the Democratic Republic of Congo possibly hundreds of thousands of women and girls were brutally raped. In WEAPON OF WAR military perpetrators unveil what lies behind this brutal behavior and the strategies of rape as a war crime. An ex-rebel explains how he raped. Like for many ex-soldiers, starting a normal life again is a struggle filled with trauma. In an attempt to reconcile with his past, he decides to meets one of his victims in an attempt to obtain forgiveness. Captain Basima is working as a priest in Congo's army and confronts perpetrators of rape. He urges them to change. Just like he did.","popularity":0.862,"poster_path":null,"release_date":"2009-11-29","title":"Weapon of War: Confessions of rape in Congo","video":false,"vote_average":0.0,"vote_count":0},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":"/hrNEUPygFp7UrGheo2nCMjfmv7d.jpg","genre_ids":[12,99],"id":389109,"original_language":"en","original_title":"When Elephants Were Young","overview":"A young man and his young elephant street beg in gritty Bangkok amid the controversial elephant business that threatens their survival, until the opportunity comes to release the elephant to the wild.","popularity":3.222,"poster_path":"/htTRyqt5j0r33ChiDid9IfFFEHj.jpg","release_date":"2016-08-12","title":"When Elephants Were Young","video":false,"vote_average":8.5,"vote_count":2},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99,10402,36],"id":389112,"original_language":"ar","original_title":"في إثر مادة سحرية","overview":"Robert Lachmann was a German-Jewish ethnomusicologist. In the 1930s, his radio show \"Oriental Music\" explored the musical traditions of Palestine and included regular live performances by musicians from different ethnic and religious groups. Inspired by Lachmann’s musicological studies, Palestinian artist Jumana Manna travels through Israel and the Palestinian territories of today with recordings from the programme. What do these songs sound like now when performed by Moroccan, Kurdish, or Yemenite Jews, by Samaritans, members of the urban and rural Palestinian communities, Bedouins and Coptic Christians?","popularity":1.365,"poster_path":"/1WImrQrFtUFEGJUaF8YfGlmEuSA.jpg","release_date":"2015-09-17","title":"A Magical Substance Flows Into Me","video":false,"vote_average":6.8,"vote_count":4},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99],"id":388445,"original_language":"en","original_title":"Quarry","overview":"Marble—in its raw state and as a noble product—is the matter that Quarry is made of. The film portrays two distinct interiors, a large underground marble quarry in Vermont, and several showrooms of Manhattan luxury condos.
